Metadata: This fact sheet describes some of the contaminants which can be found in fish and lists the health advisories issued by the California Department of Health Services over the past several years. Results from laboratory testing programs are used to determine if a public health hazard exists in eating sport-caught fish from certain locations in California where elevated levels of DDT, PCBs, chlordane and mercury have been reported. Recommendations for consumption levels are offered. Also available in Spanish (CUIMR-​G-​91-​007).
